job_description: Software Engineer 3 (contract) - job post Boeing 9,061 reviews El Segundo, CA 90245 Contract Boeing 9,061 reviews Read what people are saying about working here. You must create an Indeed account before continuing to the company website to apply Apply on company site save-icon Job details Job Type Contract The program has no accommodation for anything less than 100% on site. No work can be done remotely or in an unclassified environment. Job Description At Boeing, we are all innovators on a mission to connect, protect, explore and inspire. From the seabed to outer space, you’ll learn and grow, contributing to work that shapes the world. Find your future with us. Boeing Satellite Division in El Segundo is seeking Experienced Software Engineers, passionate about space and excited to work in a multi-disciplined, collaborative engineering environment to design, develop and implement control and communications software for a new fleet of Boeing satellites. A variety of projects to match diverse interests include: Software infrastructure and device drivers for new embedded processors and hardware interfaces to satellite sensors and actuators. Communication payload resource control, data management and network interfaces. Guidance and navigation control algorithms. Web-based tools and services supporting satellite development and operations. Integration and test of satellite control software using simulators and ground systems. Primary Responsibilities: Responsible for full life-cycle development including requirements analysis, software architecture, design, coding, unit test, integration and formal qualification. Candidate should possess excellent communications skills to participate in design and code reviews, have a thorough understanding of version control and software quality attributes, such as testability, portability and maintainability, and enjoy a self-driven and collaborative development approach. Boeing is a Drug Free Workplace where post offer applicants and employees are subject to testing for marijuana, cocaine, opioids, amphetamines, PCP, and alcohol when criteria is met as outlined in our policies. **This position requires a DoD SECRET Degree and typical experience in engineering classification: Bachelor's and 5 or more years' experience, Master's degree with 3 or more years' experience or PhD degree with experience. Bachelor, Master or Doctorate of Science degree from an accredited course of study, in engineering, computer science, mathematics, physics or chemistry. ABET is the preferred, although not required, accreditation standard. Degree in computer engineering, computer science or equivalent is preferred. Basic Qualifications (Required Skills/Experience): This position requires the ability to obtain a US Security Clearance, for which the US Government requires US Citizenship. (Post Start) 5+ years of software development experience in C++ using object oriented design methods. Hands-on experience with embedded/real-time OS (Linux, VxWorks, Integrity) and CAN or SpaceWire protocols. Preferred Qualifications (Desired Skills/Experience): Proficiency in design and implementation of multi-threaded real-time applications; use of TCP/IP protocols and user/kernel level OS abstractions. Hands-on experience with Java, C#, JavaScript, Python, TCL, XML. Experience with avionics control algorithms, search algorithms and math libraries, telemetry and command handling. Hands-on experience with hardware interfaces, embedded processor architectures, I/O device drivers and board support packages. Hands-on experience in networking, SQL and noSQL databases, web-based development. Proficiency in UML modeling, test-driven development, Agile process and DevOps tools. REQUIRED SKILLS/QUALIFICATIONS: Min 3 years of SW experience 2+ years of C++ Development 1+ years of Linux full development SW lifecycle Preferred Skills/Qualifications: Python JIRA ATLASSIAN TOOLS

Embedded Flight Software Engineer - Pasadena, CA - job post CI Software Pasadena, CA 91109 • Hybrid remote $75 - $110 an hour -  Full-time, Contract Responded to 51-74% of applications in the past 30 days, typically within 6 days. Apply now Apply now save-icon Job details Salary $75 - $110 an hour Job Type Full-time Contract Full-Time Long-Term contract role at a prestigious DoD-affiliated company. We are looking for a Flight Software Engineer for a planetary mission to support software engineering activities associated with developing and delivering embedded flight software (FSW) products for a large-scale project. As an Embedded/Flight Software Engineer, you will be part of a team with unique world-class expertise in Avionics System Engineering, Flight Command and Data Handling (C&DH) Software, Avionics System Integration, Test, Operations, and Software Technology Research. This position will work with low-level flight software, implementing and modifying bootloaders and SUROMs. As part of the team, you will push the envelope of what’s possible and have the opportunity to implement, configure, and modify real-time operating systems and implement or test spacecraft capabilities such as command, communication, data management, instrument managers, and fault protection. This position provides many attractive programming opportunities, including working on device drivers. Job Responsibilities Include, But Are Not Limited To: Modifying, implementing, and maintaining SUROMs and bootloaders. Configuring and modifying real-time operating systems. Designing and implementing real-time flight software for spacecraft in C. Develop test plans and unit tests and evaluate test results. Run tests against simulators and testbeds. Identifying and troubleshooting technical issues with flight software in an integrated system. Working as part of a team with experienced flight software developers. Mandatory Skills: Experience with developing, modifying, and maintaining SUROMs and bootloaders. Recent Flight Software Experience. Experience modifying VxWorks and Greenhills Integrity at the operating system level. Experience with embedded software development. Excellent C programming skills. Familiarity with assembly language. Multi-threaded programming. Coursework in operating systems, computer architecture, algorithms, and data structures. Work Location: This work may be hybrid, generally requiring three days in the Pasadena office and two days remote. This general guideline will be based on the needs of the project(s) and the discretion of the project leadership. Required Education and Experience: This position requires a B.S. in Computer Science or Computer Engineering or a related technical discipline with a minimum of 6 years of related experience, a Master’s degree in similar fields with a minimum of 4 years of related experience, or a Ph.D. with two years of related experience. This position requires a U.S. person eligible to obtain any required Export Authorization. Contact: Please get in touch with Tavish at CI Sofware: Tavish . Peckham @ cisotware . com Ref #02272023 Job Types: Full-time, Contract Pay: $75.00 - $110.00 per hour Benefits: 401(k) Dental insurance Health insurance Paid time off Vision insurance Schedule: 8 hour shift Ability to commute/relocate: Pasadena, CA 91109: Reliably commute or planning to relocate before starting work (Required) Experience: Developing, modifying, & maintaining SUROMs and bootloaders: 2 years (Required) Flight Software: 2 years (Required) Modifying VxWorks / Greenhills Integrity at OS level: 1 year (Required) Embedded software: 2 years (Required) C: 3 years (Required) Assembly Language: 2 years (Required) Multi-threaded programming: 2 years (Required) Python or C++: 1 year (Preferred) Work Location: Hybrid remote in Pasadena, CA 91109 Health insurance If you require alternative methods of application or screening, you must approach the employer directly to request this as Indeed is not responsible for the employer's application process.
